definition: to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
the chirping of birds or insects/noise/clamor/buzzing/disturbance
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Once famous, he is now a mere object of pity.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经名噪一时，但现在不过是一个让人怜悯的对象。

sentences.english: The number of reputable hero, an instant fall.
sentences.chinese: 有多少英雄名噪一时，瞬间陨落。

sentences.english: The Phrygian headgear of French Revolution fame might be one influence.
sentences.chinese: 法国革命时期名噪一时的头巾也可能是帽子的来源。
那位作家在1930年左右名噪一时。

definition: all the rage for a time/grand fashion for a limited time
to make a name/to become famous
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
to enjoy a short-lived fame or position of power
well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
